message_1: Simplify the expression 2 sin(x) cos(x) - cos^2(x) + sin^2(x) + sin(x) cos(x) - sin^2(x) - cos(x) sin(x) where x represents an angle in radians.
message_2:
To simplify the given expression, we can first group the like terms together:

2 sin(x) cos(x) + sin(x) cos(x) - cos(x) sin(x) - cos^2(x) + sin^2(x) - sin^2(x)

Now, we can combine the terms:

(2 sin(x) cos(x) + sin(x) cos(x) - cos(x) sin(x)) - cos^2(x) + sin^2(x) - sin^2(x)

This simplifies to:

2 sin(x) cos(x) - cos^2(x)

Now, we can use the trigonometric identity sin^2(x) + cos^2(x) = 1:

2 sin(x) cos(x) - (1 - sin^2(x))

This is the simplified expression:

2 sin(x) cos(x) - 1 + sin^2(x)
